The Surprisingly Smart Way to Get Feedback: QR Codes on Receipts

Let‚Äôs be honest‚Äîmost receipts end up crumpled in pockets, tossed in bins, or used to wipe ketchup off a toddler‚Äôs face. But what if that little slip of paper could actually help you improve your business?

Adding a QR code to your receipt that links to a one-question feedback form is one of the simplest, most scalable ways to collect customer insights. It‚Äôs fast, discreet, and doesn‚Äôt require anyone to download an app or remember a URL. Just scan, tap, done.

Why Receipts Are Secretly the Best Feedback Channel

Receipts are printed constantly. Whether you run a coffee shop, salon, retail store, or restaurant, you‚Äôre handing out thousands of them every month. That‚Äôs thousands of chances to ask: ‚ÄúHow was your experience?‚Äù

And because the receipt lands in the customer‚Äôs hand right after the transaction, it‚Äôs the perfect moment to catch honest, in-the-moment feedback. No follow-up emails. No awkward surveys. Just a quick scan and a single question.

What Makes QR Code Feedback Forms So Effective?

  • They‚Äôre mobile-friendly
    Most people already have their phone out. A QR code that leads to a fast-loading form (like FabForm.io) feels natural.

  • They‚Äôre frictionless
    No login, no multi-step survey. Just one question. ‚ÄúHow was your visit?‚Äù ‚ÄúWas the service friendly?‚Äù ‚ÄúDid your order arrive on time?‚Äù

  • They‚Äôre customizable
    With FabForm, you can brand your form, choose your question, and even redirect users to a thank-you page or promo code after they submit.

  • They‚Äôre trackable
    Want to know which store location gets the best feedback? Use unique QR codes for each branch and compare results.

  • They‚Äôre affordable
    Unlike some form builders that charge per response or limit branding, FabForm gives you unlimited responses and full control‚Äîfor a flat, one-time fee.

How to Set It Up (Without Losing Your Mind)

  1. Create a one-question form in FabForm.io
    Keep it simple. ‚ÄúHow was your visit today?‚Äù works wonders.

  2. Generate a QR code linked to your form
    Use any QR generator or FabForm‚Äôs built-in tools.

  3. Add the QR code to your receipt template
    Position it near the bottom with a friendly prompt like:
    ‚ÄúTell us how we did‚Äîscan here. It takes 5 seconds, promise.‚Äù

  4. Test it on your phone
    Make sure it loads fast and looks clean. FabForm‚Äôs forms are built for mobile, so you‚Äôre covered.

  5. Track responses by location or staff
    Want to know how your Saturday crew compares to your weekday team? Use separate QR codes and see what the data says.

These are all subtle ways to collect customer feedback using QR codes on receipts‚Äîwithout annoying anyone or sounding like a corporate robot.

Final Thoughts (and a Little Nudge)

If you‚Äôre still using receipts just to show prices and taxes, you‚Äôre missing a golden opportunity. QR code feedback forms are fast, friendly, and surprisingly effective‚Äîespecially when you keep it to one question.
